name: Dropbox Upload Form
author: Henrik Östlund

sections.description: This plugin lets you insert a upload form on your pages so visitors can upload files to a Dropbox account.
sections.installation:
1. Upload plugin-directory to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. Go to https://www.dropbox.com/developers/ and create a application. You need to copy your Applications API Key and API Secret. Create the Application for the user you want to upload files to.
  4. Place [wp-dropbox] on a page.
sections.faq:
Requirements

This plugin requires PHP 5.3, with Curl.

Is this your first WordPress plugin

Yes indeed, so don’t blame me if it breaks.
sections.changelog:
0.2.1

  • Works with Dropbox API v1
  • Updated dropbox class to latest version

0.1.5

  • Quick bugfix with the new Dropbox class

0.1.2

  • Updated dropbox class to latest version

0.1.1

  • No need to store the users password

0.1.0

  • Change from CURL to Dropbox native API
  • I now use Tijs Verkoyen Dropbox class
  • Plugin requires PHP5
  • Bugfixes

0.0.5

  • Bugfixes

0.0.3

  • Fixing some bugs in readme.txt.
  • Second initial release.

short_description: Inserts a upload form for visitors to upload files to a Dropbox account
